com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.swing.adapter

Class AbstractSwingMainMenuView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.swing.adapter.AbstractSwingMainMenuView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MenuPresenter.MenuView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContextMenuDialog, MainMenuToolbarViewSwingAdapter, MainMenuViewSwingAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractSwingMainMenuView
extends Object
implements MenuPresenter.MenuView
    The class AbstractSwingMainMenuView is used for the common parts of swing menu creation.

      • addCommand

        public final void addCommand(Command command)
        Description copied from interface: MenuPresenter.MenuView
        This method will be called once for each command at present method in GuiController. At this point it is useful to create a map between the commands and the created GUI-objects for later update via MenuPresenter.MenuView.update(Command).
        Specified by:
        addCommand in interface MenuPresenter.MenuView
        Parameters:
        command - The Command you have to add. The click action could be found at Command.getClickHandler().
        Note: Commands could contain sub commands. See: Command.getCommands().

      • update

        public void update(Command command)
        Specified by:
        update in interface MenuPresenter.MenuView
        Parameters:
        command - The Command to be updated. You have to update the GUI-object created by MenuPresenter.MenuView.addCommand(Command).
